overview: From 2025-08-13 to 2025-08-14, elizaos/eliza had 1 new PRs (0 merged), 9 new issues, and 9 active contributors.

topIssues.title: make sessions api available to `api-client` package

topPRs.title: fix: resolve `elizaos publish` command issues with --test and --npm flags
topPRs.author: yungalgo
topPRs.body:
This PR fixes two minor issues with the `elizaos publish` command:

**1. Fix `elizaos publish --test` failing out of the box**

When running `elizaos publish --test` OOTB, we get an error:
```
[2025-08-13 06:54:20] ERROR: Failed to update file: 404 Not Found
[2025-08-13 06:54:20] ERROR: Repository or path not found: yungalgo/registry/test-files/.gitkeep/
```

**Root cause**: The `ensureDirectory` function was incorrectly passing parameters to `updateFile`. It was passing the full repository string (e.g., `"username/repo"`) as a single parameter, but `updateFile` expects separate `owner` and `repo` parameters.

**Fix**: Split the repository string into owner and repo components before calling `updateFile`.

**2. Remove GitHub repository references when using `--npm` flag**

When running `elizaos publish --npm`, we publish to npm only (skipping GitHub repo creation), but the package.json still included repository and bugs URLs pointing to a non-existent GitHub repository. This shows up on the npm package page as broken links.

**Root cause**: The publish flow was setting repository placeholders regardless of the --npm flag.

**Fix**: 
- Delete `repository` and `bugs` fields from package.json when `--npm` flag is used
- Make the `repository` field optional in `PackageMetadata` interface
- Only include repository in metadata when it actually exists

## Testing

- ✅ Tested `elizaos publish --test` - now completes successfully
- ✅ Tested `elizaos publish --npm` - package.json no longer includes phantom GitHub URLs
- ✅ Verified no regressions in standard `elizaos publish` flow

## Changes

- `packages/cli/src/utils/github.ts`: Fixed parameter passing in `ensureDirectory`
- `packages/cli/src/commands/publish/index.ts`: Added logic to remove repository/bugs fields for npm-only publishing
- `packages/cli/src/commands/publish/utils/metadata.ts`: Made repository field conditional
- `packages/cli/src/commands/publish/types.ts`: Made repository field optional in interface
